headline: Jim Cramer Says Those Building Own Chips May Have To Worry About Allocations After Meta Deal, Calls Smugness Toward Nvidia 'Tiresome'
summary: CNBC's Jim Cramer warned that rivals may face tighter GPU allocations after Meta Platforms Inc deepened its long-term AI infrastructure partnership with NVIDIA Corp, even as Meta continues diversifying with in-house chips and AMD and Google alternatives amid ongoing supply constraints.

headline: How AMD’s 200 MW Helios AI Data Center Blueprint in India Has Changed Its Investment Story
summary: In February 2026, Tata Consultancy Services’ HyperVault subsidiary and Advanced Micro Devices expanded their collaboration to co-develop a Helios-based rack-scale AI infrastructure blueprint in India, targeting up to 200 MW of AI-ready data center capacity using AMD Instinct MI455X GPUs, next-generation EPYC “Venice” CPUs, Pensando Vulcano NICs and the ROCm software stack. This move gives AMD a full-stack reference deployment in one of the fastest-growing AI markets, potentially...

headline: Nvidia to sell Meta millions of chips in multiyear deal
summary: Nvidia on Tuesday said it has signed a multiyear deal to sell Meta Platforms millions of its current ‌and future artificial intelligence chips, including central processing units that compete ‌with products from Intel and Advanced Micro Devices.  Nvidia did not disclose a value for the deal, ​but said it includes its current Blackwell chips as well as its forthcoming Rubin AI chips.  It also includes standalone installations of its Grace and Vera central processors.

raw.headline: Nvidia to sell Meta millions of chips in multiyear deal
raw.summary: Nvidia on Tuesday said it has signed a multiyear deal to sell Meta Platforms millions of its current ‌and future artificial intelligence chips, including central processing units that compete ‌with products from Intel and Advanced Micro Devices.  Nvidia did not disclose a value for the deal, ​but said it includes its current Blackwell chips as well as its forthcoming Rubin AI chips.  It also includes standalone installations of its Grace and Vera central processors.

headline: AMD Ties TCS Helios Rollout To Long Term AI Data Center Story
summary: AMD (NasdaqGS:AMD) and Tata Consultancy Services expanded their partnership to deploy the Helios rack-scale AI infrastructure in India. The collaboration targets large-scale AI data centers across the country and is aligned with India's national AI initiatives. Helios combines AMD GPUs, CPUs, and networking gear with TCS's enterprise services to serve hyperscalers, AI firms, and public sector projects. For you as an investor looking at AMD, this move indicates how the company is positioning...

headline: Efinix Announces Boon Chye (BC) Ooi Joining Board of Directors
summary: CUPERTINO, Calif., February 17, 2026--Efinix®, Inc., the FPGA pioneer accelerating edge AI innovation, today announced that Boon Chye (BC) Ooi has joined its Board of Directors. Ooi, a semiconductor industry veteran with more than 45 years of operational leadership experience, will provide strategic guidance as Efinix scales its business and expands its market presence in FPGA and edge AI applications.

raw.headline: Efinix Announces Boon Chye (BC) Ooi Joining Board of Directors
raw.summary: CUPERTINO, Calif., February 17, 2026--Efinix®, Inc., the FPGA pioneer accelerating edge AI innovation, today announced that Boon Chye (BC) Ooi has joined its Board of Directors. Ooi, a semiconductor industry veteran with more than 45 years of operational leadership experience, will provide strategic guidance as Efinix scales its business and expands its market presence in FPGA and edge AI applications.

headline: Nvidia Stock Falls. There Are Reasons to Believe It Will Rally.
summary: Nvidia  stock was edging down early Tuesday.  Wall Street is looking to the company’s earnings report, due Feb. 25, as a catalyst to get the stock moving upward again.  “We expect better results and guidance as GB300 [Blackwell AI hardware] continues to ramp through 1H26…AI demand is supported by ever-increasing hyperscale capex plans,” wrote Susquehanna analyst Christopher Rolland in a research note on Tuesday.
